Package voltage.core

Class VoltageViewport

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageComponent
voltage.core.VoltageViewport
public class VoltageViewport
extends VoltageComponent
A scrollable view. Add Voltage Components to this view. Jacks are not allowed inside this component.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class voltage.core.VoltageComponent

    componentName, displayName

      Parameters:

      displayName - the display name to use.
      module - the module this is to go on.

  • Method Details

    • AddVoltageComponent

      public boolean AddVoltageComponent​(VoltageComponent child, int x, int y)
      Add a child component at specified x and y.
      Parameters:
      child - the child component.
      x - the x coordinate for the child relative to this viewport.
      y - the y coordinate for the child relative to this viewport.
      Returns:
      true if successful. Note that you cannot add jacks to viewport objects.

    • RemoveVoltageComponent

      public void RemoveVoltageComponent​(VoltageComponent child)
      Removes a child component from this viewport.
      Parameters:
      child - the child component to remove.

    • NumVoltageComponents

      public int NumVoltageComponents()
      Returns the number of children components.
      Returns:
      the number of children.

      public VoltageComponent GetVoltageComponent​(int index)
      Gets a child component.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the child to get.
      Returns:
      the child component.

    • SetViewedSize

      public void SetViewedSize​(int width, int height)
      Sets the size of the viewed size.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the viewed area.
      height - the height of the viewed area.

      public int GetViewedWidth()

      Returns:
      the height

    • SetViewedPosition

      public void SetViewedPosition​(int xPix, int yPix)
      Sets the viewed position This will adjust scroll bars and scroll if necessary to the offset of the viewed area. If there are no scrollbars, this will not do anything.
      Parameters:
      xPix - the x coordinate
      yPix - the y coordinate

    • GetViewedPositionX

      public int GetViewedPositionX()
      Gets the X offset in the view.
      Returns:
      the x coordinate.

    • GetViewedPositionY

      public int GetViewedPositionY()
      Gets the Y offset in the view.
      Returns:
      the y coordinate.

    • SetShowScrollbarsIfNeeded

      public void SetShowScrollbarsIfNeeded​(boolean bShowHorizontal, boolean bShowVertical)
      Should the viewport use scrollbars?
      Parameters:
      bShowHorizontal - set to true to use a horizontal scrollbar if necessary.
      bShowVertical - set to true to use a vertical scrollbar if necessary.

    • SetScrollThickness

      public void SetScrollThickness​(int pixels)
      Sets the scrollbar thickness in pixels.
      Parameters:
      pixels - the thickness.

    • GetScrollThickness

      public int GetScrollThickness()
      Gets the scrollbar thickness
      Returns:
      the thickness in pixels.

    • CanScrollVertically

      public boolean CanScrollVertically()
      Is the view bigger vertically than the viewport?
      Returns:
      true if the user can scroll vertically.

    • CanScrollHorizontally

      public boolean CanScrollHorizontally()
      Is the view bigger horizontally than the viewport?
      Returns:
      true if the user can scroll horizontally.

    • SetScrollSingleStep

      public void SetScrollSingleStep​(int xPixels, int yPixels)
      Sets the amount that a mouse click in the track will move a scrollbar
      Parameters:
      xPixels - the amount to move on track clicks on the horizontal scrollbar.
      yPixels - the amount to move on track clicks on the vertical scrollbar.

    • SetZoom

      public void SetZoom​(float zoomAmount)
      Sets a zoom for the viewed items.
      Parameters:
      zoomAmount - 1.0 is normal. 2.0 would be 2 times bigger. 0.5 would be half size.

    • SetHorizontalZoom

      public void SetHorizontalZoom​(float zoomAmount)
      Sets a horizontal zoom for the viewed items.
      Parameters:
      zoomAmount - 1.0 is normal. 2.0 would be 2 times bigger. 0.5 would be half size.

    • SetVerticalZoom

      public void SetVerticalZoom​(float zoomAmount)
      Sets a vertical zoom for the viewed items.
      Parameters:
      zoomAmount - 1.0 is normal. 2.0 would be 2 times bigger. 0.5 would be half size.

    • GetHorizontalZoom

      public float GetHorizontalZoom()

      Returns:
      the zoomAmount 1.0 is normal. 2.0 would be 2 times bigger. 0.5 would be half size.

    • GetVerticalZoom

      public float GetVerticalZoom()
      Gets the vertical zoom for the viewed items.
      Returns:
      the zoomAmount 1.0 is normal. 2.0 would be 2 times bigger. 0.5 would be half size.
